message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with distributed storage codes, which are codes used for storing data across multiple nodes in a network. The paper specifically focuses on locally repairable codes, which are a type of distributed storage code. The use of linear programming techniques to establish upper bounds on the code size suggests that the paper belongs to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The paper also addresses the update efficiency problem, which is related to the design of distributed storage codes, suggesting that it could also belong to the Distributed Systems (cs.DS), Distributed Computing (cs.DC), Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), or Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-categories.
